raw_text:
BNP leader Nick Griffin arrested
 
 The leader of the British National Party has been arrested as part of a police inquiry following the screening of a BBC documentary.
 
 A party spokesman said Nick Griffin was arrested on Tuesday morning on suspicion of incitement to commit racial hatred. West Yorkshire police confirmed they had arrested a 45-year-old man from outside their area. BNP founding chairman John Tyndall was arrested on Sunday on the same charge.
 
 In July, the BBC documentary Secret Agent featured covertly-filmed footage of BNP activists. Mr Griffin is the twelfth man to be arrested following the documentary. Nine men from West Yorkshire and another man from Leicester have been arrested and freed on bail. Seven of the men had been held variously in connection with suspected racially aggravated public order offences, conspiracy to commit criminal damage and possession of a firearm. Two men, both from Keighley, were arrested in September on suspicion of conspiracy to commit criminal damage. A 24-year-old man from Leicester was detained on Monday on suspicion of incitement to commit racial hatred. A BNP spokesperson said Mr Tyndall, from Brighton, was arrested following a speech he made in Burnley, Lancashire, and was released on police bail.
llama3.2:1b: Nick Griffin, leader of the British National Party (BNP), has been arrested on suspicion of incitement to commit racial hatred as part of a police inquiry into footage screened by the BBC documentary "Secret Agent".
llama3.2:3b: Nick Griffin, leader of the British National Party, was arrested Tuesday morning on suspicion of incitement to commit racial hatred as part of a police inquiry related to a BBC documentary. He is the 12th person to be arrested in connection with the documentary. A BNP spokesman said founding chairman John Tyndall was also arrested Sunday on the same charge and released on bail.
gemma2:2b: BNP leader Nick Griffin and former chairman John Tyndall have been arrested for incitement to commit racial hatred.  The arrests are part of a police investigation into the BBC documentary "Secret Agent" which showed footage of BNP activists.  Twelve men have now been arrested, nine from West Yorkshire, and another man from Leicester.
qwen2.5:0.5b: A British National Party leader, Nick Griffin, has been arrested by West Yorkshire police after the BBC screened a documentary featuring footage of BNP activists. Nine men have been arrested since the documentary's release, with seven men held for suspected racial hatred offences in connection with public order and conspiracy charges while two men were detained on suspicion of incitement to commit racial hatred following their arrest at the same time as the documentary.
qwen2.5:1.5b: BNP leader Nick Griffin arrested; 12 others previously arrested for similar reasons. BBC documentary screened, leading to arrest inquiries into racism. West Yorkshire police raided home of 45-year-old man suspected of racial incitement; five freed on bail with further arrests pending.
qwen2.5:3b: BNP leader Nick Griffin arrested as part of a BBC documentary screening investigation. On suspicion of incitement to commit racial hatred, he is the twelfth man arrested after filming featuring BNP activists. Nine others from West Yorkshire and Leicester have been arrested and released on bail for suspected racially aggravated public order offences, conspiracy, or firearm possession. Two more men were detained: a 24-year-old from Leicester for incitement to commit racial hatred and John Tyndall (founder) of Brighton for a speech in Burnley, both released on police bail.

smollm:1.7b: The summary should be: Nick Griffin was arrested on Tuesday morning for inciting racial hatred after the BBC documentary screened. He is the 12th man to be arrested since the documentary's screening. Nine men from West Yorkshire and another man from Leicester have been arrested and released on bail, while seven of them were held for suspected racially aggravated public order offences, conspiracy to commit criminal damage and possession of a firearm. Two men, both from Keighley, were detained in September on suspicion of conspiracy to commit criminal damage. A 24-year-old man from Leicester was arrested on Monday after making a speech that he said incited racial hatred.

The British National Party leader Nick Griffin was arrested as part of a police inquiry following the screening of a BBC documentary. Griffin was charged with incitement to commit racial hatred, with West Yorkshire police confirming their arrest of a 45-year-old man from outside that area. BNP founding chairman John Tyndall was also arrested on the same charge. Nine men from West Yorkshire, another man from Leicester, and two from Keighley were arrested or released on bail. Griffin's arrest marks his twelfth in this inquiry. Tyndall made a speech at Burnley and was released on bail.
tinyllama:1.1b: British National Party leader Nick Griffin has been arrested along with another party speaker as part of an investigation into racism and incitement to hatred. A BNP founding chairman and a tweetlfth man, both from West Yorkshire and other men from Leicester and Lancashire, have also been detained on suspicion of incitement to commit criminal damage and possession of a firearm. Two other men, both from Keighley, were arrested in September and are being investigated for conspiracy to commit criminal damage. A BNP speaker was released on police baile after his speech in Burnley, Lancashire.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The British National Party (BNP) leader Nick Griffin has been arrested as part of an investigation into whether he incited racial hatred during the screening of a BBC documentary. The party spokesperson confirmed that Mr. Griffin was arrested on Tuesday morning in West Yorkshire, England. He is the 12th person to be arrested following the documentary, which featured covertly-filmed footage of BNP members. In July, the BBC Secret Agent documentary caused a wave of arrests, with nine men from West Yorkshire and another man from Leicester being held for alleged public order offenses. The BNP has not released any further details about Mr. Griffin's arrest or the nature of his charges.
phi:2.7b: Nick Griffin, leader of the British National Party, has been arrested as part of a police inquiry following the screening of a BBC documentary. A party spokesman said Griffin was arrested for suspicion of incitement to commit racial hatred. This follows the arrest of John Tyndall on the same charge in July. Nine men from West Yorkshire and another man from Leicester have already been arrested, with seven being released on bail. Two more men, both from Keighley, were detained on suspicion of conspiracy to commit criminal damage. A BNP spokesperson confirmed that Mr Tyndall was arrested following a speech he made in Burnley, Lancashire, and is also on police bail.

hermes3:3b: BNP leader Nick Griffin arrested for racially hate-inciting, post-BBC documentary screening inquiry.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: BNP leader Nick Griffin was arrested alongside founding chairman John Tyndall for suspected incitement to commit racial hatred after the BBC screened a documentary featuring covert footage of BNP activists. Seven of the arrests were related to suspected racially aggravated public order offences, conspiracy to commit criminal damage, and possession of a firearm.
stablelm2:1.6b: BNP leader Nick Griffin has been arrested on suspicion of inciting racial hatred after being featured in the BBC documentary Secret Agent. This follows the arrest of other BNP members including founding chairman John Tyndall. Nine men have been arrested and freed on bail, with some previously held for different offenses. Two men from Keighley were also detained on suspicion of conspiracy to commit criminal damage.
granite3.1-dense:2b: British National Party (BNP) leader Nick Griffin was arrested on Tuesday by West Yorkshire police on suspicion of incitement to commit racial hatred in connection with a BBC documentary called "Secret Agent." This marks the twelfth arrest related to the documentary, which features covert footage of BNP activists. Nine previous arrests were made from West Yorkshire and one from Leicester, all released on bail due to various suspected offenses including racially aggravated public order crimes, conspiracy to commit criminal damage, and firearm possession. John Tyndall, the BNP's founding chairman, was also arrested in Burnley, Lancashire, on suspicion of incitement to commit racial hatred during a speech. Both Griffin and Tyndall were released on police bail following their respective arrests.

West Yorkshire police confirmed the arrest of a 45-year-old man, while BNP founding chairman John Tyndall was also arrested on the same charge. The documentary Secret Agent featured covert footage of BNP activists, leading to the arrest of twelve individuals. Other arrests included men from West Yorkshire and Leicester, linked to racially aggravated offences, conspiracy to commit criminal damage, and firearm possession. Tyndall was arrested after a speech in Burnley and later released on bail.
reference: Mr Griffin is the twelfth man to be arrested following the documentary.A party spokesman said Nick Griffin was arrested on Tuesday morning on suspicion of incitement to commit racial hatred.A BNP spokesperson said Mr Tyndall, from Brighton, was arrested following a speech he made in Burnley, Lancashire, and was released on police bail.Two men, both from Keighley, were arrested in September on suspicion of conspiracy to commit criminal damage.Nine men from West Yorkshire and another man from Leicester have been arrested and freed on bail.
